org.certificateservices.custom.c2x.etsits103097.v131.validator

Class ETSI103097CertificateValidator

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.certificateservices.custom.c2x.ieee1609dot2.validator.BaseCertificateValidator
      • org.certificateservices.custom.c2x.etsits103097.v131.validator.ETSI103097CertificateValidator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CertificateValidator

    public class ETSI103097CertificateValidator
extends BaseCertificateValidator
    Certificate Validator for verifying and validating ETSI103097Certificates.

    The validator verifies the signature, region, validity and that permissions are consistent.

    For regions is only countryOnly regions allowed. No other.

    • Method Detail

      • checkCertServicePermissionInAppPermissions

        public void checkCertServicePermissionInAppPermissions(byte ssPVersion,
                                                       byte ssPPermissions,
                                                       Certificate[] certificateChain)
                                                throws InvalidCertificateException
        Method to check if the first certificate in supplied chain have a specific appPermission set in its SecuredCertificateRequestService (623) SSP Data.
        Parameters:
        ssPVersion - the version byte of the SSP Data (Use SecuredCertificateRequestServicePermissions.VERSION_ constants)
        ssPPermissions - the permission to look up in the SSP Data (Use SecuredCertificateRequestServicePermission constants)
        certificateChain - the certificate chain to check permission, only the first certificate that have its certificate checked.
        Throws:
        InvalidCertificateException - if given permission wasn't found in the certificate.

      • checkCertServicePermissionInIssuePermissions

        public void checkCertServicePermissionInIssuePermissions(byte ssPVersion,
                                                         byte ssPPermissions,
                                                         EndEntityType endEntityType,
                                                         int chainLengthIndex,
                                                         Certificate[] certificateChain)
                                                  throws InvalidCertificateException
        Method to check if the first certificate in supplied chain have a specific certIssuePermission set in its SecuredCertificateRequestService (623) SSP Data.
        Parameters:
        ssPVersion - the version byte of the SSP Data (Use SecuredCertificateRequestServicePermissions.VERSION_ constants)
        ssPPermissions - the permission to look up in the SSP Data (Use SecuredCertificateRequestServicePermission constants)
        endEntityType - the end entity type to lookup
        chainLengthIndex - index parameter send to retrieve the correct group permissions from certificate. If validating chain that starts with end entity certificate should chainLengthIndex be 0, if certificate chain starts with issuer of end entity certificate it should be 1 and so on incremented up to root certificate in chain.
        certificateChain - the certificate chain to lookup cert issuer permissions if the first certificate.
        Throws:
        InvalidCertificateException - if no given permissions was found in certificate.
